title.narrative: UNCONDITIONAL MULTIPURPOSE CASH TRANSFERS TO VULNERABLE CONGOLESE HOUSEHOLDS IN ITURI AND NORTH KIVU AND REINFORCING OF NUTRITION PACKAGE THROUGH INFANT AND YOUNG CHILD FEEDING (IYCF) ACTIVITIES

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide life-saving multi-purpose cash and nutrition assistance to internally displaced persons, returnees and host community members in Ituri and North Kivu. This WFP project multipurpose unconditional nutrition-sensitive cash assistance to food insecure households for six months to meet their basic needs, and supports infant and young child feeding activities including screening for acute malnutrition. The multi-purpose cash component of the project provides life-saving assistance to 34,240 people, including 13,000 women, 12,670 men, 21,570 children, and 1,000 persons with disabilities. The nutrition component provides life-saving assistance to 10,500 people including 7,875 women, 2,625 girls, and 300 persons with disabilities.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS CONGO, DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF THE UNDERFUNDED EMERGENCIES MULTIPLE EMERGENCIES 2021

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: 31050 crisis-affected acutely food insecure people are targeted by WFP and empowered and less inclined to adopt negative coping mechanisms (which could include child labour, forced migration of a household member for work, taking part in harmful work such as mining and criminal activities…)
Consumption-based Coping Strategy Index (Average) female headed familyTarget per province: Ituri: <32.89North Kivu: < 17.35
Number of awareness-raising meetings dedicated to gender issues
Number of persons with disabilities who receive cash assistance
Number of targeted households having unhindered access to WFP programmes
Proportion of households where women and men jointly make decisions about the cash received from WFP Target per province: Ituri : 50 % ; North Kivu: 50%
Proportion of targeted people who report that WFP programmes are dignified

31050 crisis-affected acutely food insecure populations targeted by WFP and partners in DRC in North Kivu and Ituri receive sufficient cash to meet their basic food and nutrient and non-food requirements

AP.1b Proportion of assisted people who state that they are aware of their rights and entitlements (informed about the programme, who is included, what people will receive, duration of assistance and how to access WFP complaints and feedback mechanism)

Nutrition sensitive approach that reinforces the caring practices through the promotion of the IYCF in the identified communities in Ituri and referral systems benefiting around 10500 individuals.
